page.title: 01Landscape of Grafham Water.
page.content: { Grafham Water,}a reservoir built in the 1960's, completely dominates this block. Its western shore is bounded by a{nature reserve}which extends to the northern shore. On the southern shore there is a{fishing lodge} and the {Grafham Water Sailing Club}has been established. Next door to the sailing club is the {Residential {Centre}run by the Cambridgeshire Education Authority. The village of {West Perry}lies on the southern shore. The shoreline of the reservoir has three {car parks}and a 100 acres of {picnic area.} On the north east shore lies the Village of {Grafham}which is mostly outside the block. The remaining land cover is given over to {farming, scrubland }and{ {forestry.}
